info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 27 at 1:36AM EST until November 27 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Marquette MI
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph.
* WHERE...Baraga, Gogebic, Northern Houghton, and Ontonagon Counties.
* WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ this morning to 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ this evening.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact travel this Thanksgiving Holiday. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution if you must travel. Driving could be very difficult at times, especially this morning when isolated blizzard conditions could be seen.
During lake effect snow, the weather can vary from bands of locally heavy snow to dry weather just a few miles away. Visibilities can also vary greatly. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather, visibility, and road conditions.

parameter.value: BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ THIS MORNING TO 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ THIS EVENING
